stream_context.summary: Kaze grey-boxes Course 13, an ice-castle stage, focusing almost the entire stream on prototyping a "cracking ice platform" mechanic while discussing other planned hazards and some release-video logistics.

development_findings.summary: Course 13 is roughly 60 % complete: “3 out of 5 areas done… only the office and boss area to go.”

The day’s objective was to model and program new platforming pieces, specifically cracking ice platforms, spinning ice shards, and indoor wind gusts; other brainstormed ideas include ice waves, Mario Galaxy-style appearing paths, and swinging axes.
development_findings.quote: Today our goal is to kind of greybox the level… make the platforming good.

development_findings.summary: Biobak previously suggested an “appearing path” tile set; Kaze likes it but hasn’t integrated it because the castle geometry was modeled before that idea.
development_findings.quote: Biobak’s appearing path thing, yes. I definitely want that in here. The thing is, I’ve modeled the whole castle so far without planning that in.

development_findings.summary: Implemented cracking ice platform with a three-step state (intact → cracked → dissolve) using dual textures, primitive-alpha tricks, triangle debris, and a respawn timer.
development_findings.quote: Right, so like there’s no more damage here and I can get safely off, but then if I land it again… it’s broken.

development_findings.summary: Accidentally fixed a long-standing ROM-pointer misalignment bug while writing a new geo function; music and animations now load correctly between areas.
development_findings.quote: No way—that fixed the bug, what the fuck.

development_findings.summary: Waiting on Eiza’s mini-documentary concept before finishing the slide-level reveal video.
development_findings.quote: Eiza had like a special plan for the video… I’m waiting for that to be settled first.

development_findings.summary: Plans separate release tomorrow of “Mario Builder,” a Mario-Maker-style tool, accompanied by a thumbnail and ‘satisfying clips’ video; experimenting with MrBeast-style editing and thumbnails.

context_findings.summary: Kaze and Zeina are expecting a daughter in ~two months; this may delay an F3 release.
context_findings.quote: Actually, I don’t know if I can do an F3 this year, because I’m going to have a child releasing in a bit.

context_findings.summary: Considers himself more a YouTuber/‘content creator’ than he’d like, jokes about label discomfort.
context_findings.quote: This is—it's over. Is this actually what my life has been this whole time? I've just been a YouTuber, not a game developer.

context_findings.summary: Philosophy on ads: avoids advertised products, believing ad budgets inflate consumer cost.
context_findings.quote: When I see an ad I actively decide not to buy the product anymore… the product is less cost-efficient than a product without ads.

context_findings.summary: Expresses strong negative opinions on Mario 64 DS and Yoshi’s Island remake, citing design compromises (lack of analog stick, forced character switches).
context_findings.quote: Mario 64 DS… has no right to exist… they cripple the player and make it so they can’t beat the game unless they go back to some character they didn’t want to play as.

context_findings.summary: Emotional arc: extended frustration perfecting the ice-platform effect; frequent self-deprecating humor ('I hate video games') but ends satisfied enough to move on.

biobak.summary: Provides concept of ‘appearing path’ tiles and shares blender files/textures for ice effects; offers shader advice during stream.
biobak.quote: I think what you were thinking just like that… if we added two materials on here…

zeina.summary: Subscribes during stream and participates in chat; jointly joking with Kaze about naming their child ‘Reina’ as a Wario-style rival to Zeina.

key_stories.title: Designing the Cracking Ice Platform
key_stories.summary: Kaze needs a destructible ice platform for Course 13. Over the stream he iterates textures, shaders, particle effects, and timing until a three-step crack/dissolve animation finally works.
key_stories.challenge: Create an ice tile that visually cracks on first contact and disappears on the second, without looking ‘awful.’
key_stories.process: Brainstorm mechanics, build dual-texture material in Blender, debug alpha/blend math, adjust timers, add particle debris, and tweak until acceptable.
key_stories.outcome: A functional prototype now cracks, spawns ice shards, dissolves, and will later respawn; Kaze deems it ‘fine for now.’
key_stories.key_quote: At this point, I think we just have to take it as it is.

key_stories.title: Bug Fixed by Accident
key_stories.summary: While coding a new geo function for the platform, Kaze unknowingly eliminates a long-standing pointer bug that broke music/animations when changing areas.
key_stories.challenge: Intermittent ROM-pointer misalignment caused assets to break between sub-areas.
key_stories.process: Copied code, noticed a wrong return value, corrected it; realized this inadvertently removed the larger issue.
key_stories.outcome: Area transitions now load assets correctly; Kaze celebrates the unintended fix.
key_stories.key_quote: I think I just fixed that whole thing on accident.

open_questions.context: Kaze likes Biobak’s idea but hasn’t implemented it; unclear how it will integrate into existing castle geometry.
